Performance

David Hugh-Jones

2020-06-09

Source: vignettes/website-articles/performance.Rmd
performance.Rmd

Speed

The core of santoku is written in C++. It is reasonably fast:

packageVersion("santoku")
#> [1] '0.4.0'
mb <- microbenchmark::microbenchmark(
        santoku::chop(rnorm(1e5), -2:2),
                  cut(rnorm(1e5), -2:2),
          Hmisc::cut2(rnorm(1e5), -2:2)
      )
mb
#> Unit: milliseconds
#>                               expr      min       lq     mean   median       uq
#>  santoku::chop(rnorm(1e+05), -2:2) 17.08100 20.13888 23.30020 21.46940 23.56776
#>            cut(rnorm(1e+05), -2:2) 10.23891 11.73721 14.26908 12.05713 13.23055
#>    Hmisc::cut2(rnorm(1e+05), -2:2) 30.39626 36.08008 53.44986 38.18002 40.64317
#>        max neval cld
#>   142.7800   100  a 
#>   128.3219   100  a 
#>  1462.9672   100   b
ggplot2::autoplot(mb) + ggplot2::theme_light()
#> Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will replace the existing one.
